text: 0.5 milesaway from Mimosas

While on vacation I decided to have a nice brunch here. I heard great things about the restaurant and they definitely did not disappoint!! First off the restaurant was very big on the inside and they had a really nice patio! I am definitely a patio girl but it was very busy on a Sunday so we sat inside. The decor and ambiance was very nice and tropical, our wait was only 15 minutes and we had great service. They have an amazing menu so it was hard to pick what to eat. I ordered the lobster omelet and a side of French toast. It also came with home fries. It was sooooo good. The omelet had lobster AND shrimp and had this really tasty hollandaise sauce drizzled all over it. So delicious. My boyfriend ordered the salted caramel banana stuffed French toast and OMG. It was so decadent and delicious. Even the side of eggs and sausage were so tasty. They also have a wide selection of specialty mimosas, I ordered the strawberry pineapple mimosa and it was really good. Next time I'll try the mimosa flightThis place was amazing and definitely a go to brunch spot while in Myrtle beach

On vacation with my kids. Went for Birthday Breakfast for my daughter. We started with a flight of Mimosas. And we sat outside which was a great day to do so. Everything was wonderful from the taste of the food, mimosas, to the service. Top notch! Can't wait to vacation again
OMG this place does not disappoint!Service was great! Spinach salad added Salmon Yummm!
Food and service (Fernando) were excellent. Our group tried the French toast croissant, Benedict Florentine and Bacon Avocado Omelet. Yummmm we will be back!
Great breakfast experience! Seven of us and food came out in a timely manner.We would definitely visit and recommend again.

First time eating here and was not disappointed. The food was excellent as well as the special coffee drinks. The cutest ambiance weather you sit inside our sit outside on their patio area!!! Everyone was so nice.
Everything went well. The ambiance, the location, the service and the food was perfect.The chicken and waffles were lick the plate good. The strawberry mule was yummy.Service was great.
Staff is very friendly and helpful, food is delicious and great portions. Highly recommend!

This has quickly become one of my favorite breakfast / brunch / lunch spots in Myrtle Beach. The food is always perfectly cooked & flavorful. They don't nickel & dime you for small change requests. The decor, ambiance, and patio are also beautiful (and CLEAN!) And finally, the staff is amazing! Absolutely the sweetest people. A+!
I think I found a new breakfast place to bring family and friends!!! The food was delicious, service was excellent, and it had such a cute vibe. I felt like I was on a tropical island
Excellent food, good service and  great atmosphere! Definitely a must visit when in Myrtle Beach!

While on vacation I decided to have a nice brunch here. I heard great things about the restaurant and they definitely did not disappoint!! First off the restaurant was very big on the inside and they had a really nice patio! I am definitely a patio girl but it was very busy on a Sunday so we sat inside. The decor and ambiance was very nice and tropical, our wait was only 15 minutes and we had great service. They have an amazing menu so it was hard to pick what to eat. I ordered the lobster omelet and a side of French toast. It also came with home fries. It was sooooo good. The omelet had lobster AND shrimp and had this really tasty hollandaise sauce drizzled all over it. So delicious. My boyfriend ordered the salted caramel banana stuffed French toast and OMG. It was so decadent and delicious. Even the side of eggs and sausage were so tasty. They also have a wide selection of specialty mimosas, I ordered the strawberry pineapple mimosa and it was really good. Next time I'll try the mimosa flightThis place was amazing and definitely a go to brunch spot while in Myrtle beach
0.3 milesaway from Mimosas
"OMG time!!! Are you kidding me? Perhaps I have Southern heritage, but never knew.…"
My 1st time here & it was packed. The wait wasn't too long. The food was amazing, our server gave good explanations when asked about the food. The decor & atmosphere was great as well.

Slow service! Weak drinks! My fried lobster & waffles came with bacon. Everyone at our table  received their food and I received mine 10-15 minutes later.The bacon was undercooked and the waffle was too! The waffle was doughy and not crisp at all. The lobster was over cooked.I sent it back.

This place was directly across from our hotel. While they had a wait, it was definitely worth it. The food was great and our waiter was even better. He made recommendations based on what we told him we liked. We got the cherry bomb and the peach mimosas. Both were cut garnished. The restaurant and food was very photogenic and aesthetically pleasing. Can't wait to come back next time I'm in Myrtle.

Mimosa's is a restaurant and bar in Myrtle Beach that specializes in breakfast, brunch, and lunch. They are located off of N Kings Hwy and open from 7:00 AM - 2 PM seven days a week.My family and I stopped in on a Saturday afternoon. Service was good and all the food was enjoyable.I ordered the Texas Steak Skillet. It's made with Black Angus NY Strip Steak, black bean salsa, and shaved jalapeño. All skillets are layered with fried potatoes and cheddar jack cheese, and then topped with three scrambled eggs. Delicious!Texas Steak Skillet - 8.2Croissant - 8.1Food - 8.2Service - 8.1Value - 8.1Restaurant score - 81

A MUST VISIT! I found Mimosas a few years ago while vacationing in Myrtle Beach. I have so many great things to say about this restaurant, and if you are in town, you should try to visit. First and foremost, staff is attentive, polite, and accommodating. Every interaction I've had with them has been great, they are truly there to make sure your experience is good. Restaurant itself is very clean, you can tell they take pride in this. The food is outstanding, and very fresh. Wide selection for just about anybody! Mimosas are also on point! All kinds of fun flavors and seasonal flavors too. Overall, I would highly recommend a visit. I stop by and have breakfast every day while I'm on vacation!
Food and service were amazing. I truly enjoyed the Mimosa flights. The food was delicious. The ambiance was great. I will definitely go back when I am in town.

This place is perfect - nothing more to say. This is a great place for a more upscale breakfast, not diner style like most of the recommendations you will get around Myrtle Beach. Coffee is delicious, mimosas are strongggg, and the food is amazing. $35 for a mimosa flight but we were just about crawling out of there, you get your moneys worth. Bacon Avocado Omelet, Crab Avocado Toast, and skillets were all 10/10. Must sit on the covered patio.

Found this place while searching for a great restaurant for brunch! The family enjoyed everything. Food was reasonably priced and we loved all the seafood options! Service was great our server made sure we had everything we needed. The location is perfect for outdoor dining as well!
Mimosa classic flight was really good! I had the steak and eggs with grits and my husband had the new orleans shrimp and grits without the cheese! All were very good! Will be back for sure!

Everything about Momosas was great. Our food was delicious and the latte was amazing. My wife got a mimosa and loved it. I highly recommend Mimosas for not just great food but a very cool ambiance with great service!

We had breakfast here on our last full day on vacation.  What a treat!  I never thought lobster and shrimp would work well in an omelette.  I am very glad to be wrong.  That omelette was delicious!   Everyone in my family enjoyed their meals. And the mimosas!  We got the seasonal flight and these were some of the best mimosas I ever had.  Alex, our server, was friendly and attentive.  And a relaxed casual atmosphere to spend a couple of hours and chill out.  Really loved this place.

What can be said about Mimosa's? I get it, refreshing! Spectacular! Worth the visit!First off, I visited this place on my birthday at the recommendation of Yelpers and TikTok. Let's just say that the reviews did not lie one bit and this place is now one of my favorite out of town gems.Service: thank YOU to Kaitlyn (or with a C) for her excellent recommendations with everything from beverages to food. She was attentive and made it her duty to check in on us the entire time.Ambiance: the decor was super cute and did I mention that they have both open and enclosed outdoor seating? How perfect for a beautiful summer day.Drinks: my boyfriend and I decided to order two flights so I'll list them out and rate them to save time:Seasonal Mimosas:Kiss from a Rose: 2nd FavoriteLove Bomb: least favoriteSt. Valentine: 3rd FavoriteLove potion: FAVORITEClassics:Classic: least favorite (the pulp orange juice didn't really mesh)Hawaiian: FAVORITETropical: 2nd favoriteCherry bomb: least favoriteFood:Mines: Crème Brûlée French Toast-two slices of French toast, berry compote, crème anglaise, Chantilly cream, and fresh berries (menu description) paired with a side of bacon.The French toast was DIVINE and a guilty pleasure to help balance off the mimosas. What I didn't really appreciate was the bacon because the price and quantity was a little off and we paid a lot for 3 small strips. Overall I give it 10 forks and a satisfied tummy.My boyfriend: my boyfriend ordered the Bacon Avocado Omelette- hickory smoked bacon, spinach, tomatoes, jack cheddar and diced avocado (menu description) paired with a side of wheat toast and home fries. His omelette was SCRUMPTIOUS and oh so filing. Well seasoned, perfect blend of flavors, and a generous serving of bacon inside. His home fries were golden brown, crunchy, and tasty as well. He gave his omelette 10 forks, 10 knives, and a satisfied tummy craving it the next day.No dessert! We were stuffed from a hearty and delicious breakfast and those mimosas.Do yourself a favor, hurry over to Mimosas and order themimosa flight, you won't be disappointed!
Amazing drinks and food. The mimosa flight was great, both regular and seasonal. Loved the fried lobster and waffle. The blueberry muffin was so good.

Our first time here but not our last! We went around noon on a Friday when we needed to be out of our hotel but could not go to the airport that early! We were trying to eat lunch but enough to get to almost 8:00 at night.  We had the Tuscan Scramblette, the Artisan Breakfast, and a pancake to share. Everything was really fresh with a wonderful presentation. The whole restaurant had the best decor with indoor and outdoor seating and a super fun inside and outside two sided bar.
Everything about MIMOSAS is wonderful, will be going back next month for the summer mimosa menu!!! Ambiance, Service, Food and seating is excellent

10/10! The service was amazing, we were seating immediately. We had a group of about 8 people with 2 small children and the waitress didn't skip a beat.The drinks were really refreshing and the food was outstanding!! I definitely would recommend to anyone in the area. They also have a really cute outside area too!
Hubby and I eyed this spot last year on our trip to Myrtle Beach. This year I made sure to add it to our list!! One word....DELICIOUS!! Cannot wait to go back!!

We visited Mimosa's as we were leaving Myrtle Beach and this was a great farewell breakfast! The wait was about 25 minutes. My only complaint is that the outside heaters were not on and there was not enough space to wait inside, so we did end up waiting outside in the cold air.The menu had a little something for everyone, many mimosas and cocktails to choose from as well as freshly made lattes. I had the seasonal "fall fizz" mimosa. For food, we chose the beignets, bacon & spinach omelette, and the Texas steak skillet. Our server was great and accommodated my modifications. The food was delicious and portion sizes were decent. Would definitely return!

To find a great place with a fun atmosphere, excellent service & delicious menu, go to Minosa's! Eat inside with the high ceilings or go outside on the patio & have some shade. Or sit at the bar & enjoy! We went when this place first opened & quickly added it to our favorite's list. It's a quick drive to the beach & ample parking too.

I want to make it clear that our waitress in the restaurant was perfectly fine. It was the owner named Jenta whom I find to be extremely rude. My niece and husband were sitting at the bar and had ordered 4 drinks and the bar is first come first serve and she told them to pay for their drinks and get up and move so that someone eating could sit down. Just rude. Not the first run in with her. Probably will never go back. We had a party of 6.
First visit to mimosas and we loved it. The food was great, service was great and it's a beautiful atmosphere!

Yummy! Mimosas are awesome and food is tasty. The restaurant has the ability to accommodate a lot of people which is good, but the parking is not so good. It's just a super popular restaurant as it should be. It's a very good. I would highly recommend it.

I loved this place but the food I got I tried it. I loved it, but it wasn't really for me, but it was at least good cause I like waffles and I liked that we were sitting outside which is beautiful. I love the flowers.
From the food to the service, everything today was fantastic. Kirsten was a wonderful server and made fantastic recommendations will definitely be back.
We loved this place! Great environment, the food was fresh and there was a great variety of choices. The place was nice and clean,service was quick. Would definitely go back.

Really cute breakfast place. The food was amazing. They have one of the best drink menus I've seen anywhere. Probably the best brunch place in town. It's now a "must" for us! Come check them out, you'll be glad you did!

Ok to start we are New Englanders and expect good quality food and services. This is the first high quality restaurant we have encountered. The decor in the outside areas are very pretty. They are Prepared for weather, no matter what . Mimosas flights are amazing, well  worth the money! Had Crème's brûlée French toast, which was fantastic! The hash skillet my husband had, was huge and he enjoyed but couldn't finish ! Would recommend without hesitation! You will not be disappointed!! Wish you would open one up in Connecticut

Brunch at Mimosa's is basically a life necessity at this point. If you love starting your day with great food, good vibes, and the perfect amount of bubbles (yes, I'm talking about those mimosas), this is the spot for you!First off, the menu. You ever look at a menu and just know you're about to have a hard time choosing because everything sounds so good? That's Mimosa's. From thefluffy pancakesto the savory omelets, it's like they read my brunch dreams and turned them into reality. Pro tip: Don't skip the French toast. Trust me, it's worth every calorie (and then some).Let's talk mimosas because, hello, it's in the name. They don't play around here. Whether you're into classic OJ or want to get fancy with a splash of cranberry, they've got you covered. Also, they definitely don't skimp on the champagne. It's like they've decided "brunch" means "celebration," and I'm here for it.And the staff? Friendly, fast, and they never judge when you order that second (or third) round of mimosas before noon. Respect.Long story short: Mimosa's is the brunch spot you never knew you needed in your life. Just make sure to set an alarm--or five--because you won't want to sleep in and miss out on this!

Went here on a recent visit again it was my 2nd experience. Both times the food was really good  and fairly quick service. Expect this place to be very busy most times and it is a bit pricey but good food.

I'm a local and have frequently gone to this restaurant as it is one of my favorites.  Unfortunately, on my last visit, I sent my sandwich back to the kitchen.  It was returned with a dead fly on the plate!  Seriously!!  Clearly, someone in the kitchen was mad that the sandwich was sent back and out of spite added some unnecessary "protein" to the plate.  This was off season when they weren't even crowded.  Needless to say, I will not return.

Mimosas NEVER disappoints. Their eggs are absolutely cooked to perfection, their drinks are always on point (some of the mimosas are on the sweet side but still amazing) and their breakfast items are ALL good. The wait staff is always kind and the place is always clean and beautiful (including their bathrooms). Will always be my family's favorite return breakfast spot,

THIS PLACE IS BOMB!!! We had the BEST server and the food was delicious. Listen to me... if you are a cookie dough fan.. DO NOT skip the cookie dough French toast. Drool, it was SO good. I had the strawberry pineapple mimosa--also a solid choice. The portions are huge so we were super full half way through. The inside is beautiful. Our seat had crumbs and a fork on it when we were sat, which originally had us worried but the food was worth it. It will be a MUST go back on every trip now. If I could give this place a 10 star I would.

Our family had breakfast at Mimosas not once but twice while vacationing in Myrtle! The decor is super cute and festive!  Both indoor and outdoor seating options are available. The food was outstanding and the portions were large! Our favorites included the Gypsy Skillet, Chunky Lobster Scram-blette, Sante Fe Skillet and our absolute favorite was the Birria Hash! The drinks were fun, colorful and they do not skimp on the alcohol! The food came out in a timely manner.  The service was just average. No complaints but also nothing to write home about.  Cannot wait to return when we are back in the area!

This place was amazing! Our regular breakfast place was closed on a Sunday, so we decided to give Mimosa's a try and we are so glad we did! The atmosphere is open and festive, and even though they were busy, we never felt rushed, the waitstaff was all walking around with smiles on their faces and the manager took the time to ask how our experience was going.The food matched the atmosphere. Great selection of both sweet and savory dishes (you def should try the beignets), and of course the mimosas were terrific. Highly recommend!
Service was good, food was good, drinks were good. Will definitely come back when in Myrtle Beach.
Their Nawlins Shrimp and Grits are the best we have ever had.I would make the 4 hour trip from our house just for that! Seriously!!
Atmosphere is very pleasant.  Very colorful.   Blueberry goat cheese pancakes were good not the best but very good. Crème brûlée French toast great. Grits were really, really good.
Food and services were great! I would highly recommend this restaurant. I like the option of indoor or outdoor dining for breakfast or brunch!

I had read all of the wonderful reviews about Mimosas and was so excited when  we were able to get a table today at 1030 am.  The restaurant is huge!  There are several rooms and outside seating too.  Everyone  that worked there was very friendly and polite,   This place reminded me of a mix of Famous Toastery and Blueberry Grill.  I really enjoyed my breakfast.   There wasn't a lot of healthy options but I went with the lobster omelette.  It was a very large size.   It came with home fries, fruit or grits.   I went with the grits and wheat toast.   Those were both good, too.  I was only able to eat 1/4 of the whole meal due to how big it was (which isn't a bad thing.) I also  ordered a Bloody Mary which was garnished well.   My friend has a delicious mimosa.   For her meal, She had a lobster, shrimp and bacon scramble.  She liked it very much.  The croissants were unique but she liked it.  This is a very good breakfast spot and I can see why it is well liked.   It was just missing something for the 5 strap "it factor".   I so recommend it very much? Though!

We made reservations . Seated promptly . Menu was great lots to choose from . Coffee was fresh . Creamers on the tables ... flavored which was great . Had gluten friendly pancakes with a lobster omelette . Not big on good runners since my friends one meal was served with missing items . We didn't have any alcoholic drinks but the flight of mimosas looked amazing . Little pricey but the food was hot and very good . Great first experience .

Recently had a neighborhood ladies' lunch at Mimosas/Myrtle Bch, SC. We were all seated outside on the covered veranda. It was quite lovely except there is a lot of road noise from the traffic. Ordered the Grownup Grilled Cheese with the fruit bowl. Absolutely delicious. The tomato jam gave a nice kick to the sandwich. Wish I could take some home. Would definitely order this again. There were 30 ladies who attended the lunch and the restaurant was packed so it took a while to get our lunches but worth the wait.Please check your receipt. They automatically add a 20% tip to your bill and then there is an additional line on your receipt to add an additional tip. If you aren't paying attention you could be paying 2 tips. This is a totally shady business practice and I hope the restaurant removes it. This is why I didn't give the business 5 stars.
